author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
Looks like a test -- the package has no content -- so I am closing.

Hello @fredrikekre, I am developping locally the content of PartitionedVectors.jl, see [PartitionedVectors pull-request](https://github.com/paraynaud/PartitionedVectors.jl/pull/3).
My local work is not stable, but I wanted to gain time in the registration of the module, which is why I ended up starting its registration without content.
Is this an issue if the content is added after the 0.1.0 release?

> Is this an issue if the content is added after the 0.1.0 release?

Yes? There is no point in releasing nothing. You should release code because you want others to use it and a release is a signal to the community that the package is useful and in a state where it can be used.
I understand, I will retrigger Registrator after I added the content to v0.1.0.
